I want to be helpful to my team but when I look at the GitHub I get really lost and it‚Äôs my turn to do the robot‚Äôs code this year

Lead prog/driver","username":"Mochatitan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mochatitan/{size}/237112_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T18:40:37.826Z","cooked":"

Is your team teaching you? I reccomend trying to build a robot from scratch that is just a drive train and maybe an arm motor, just so you can practice coding. Use WPILIB docs as you go to learn how to do different things. Learn in the offseason so you arent struggling in the season

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T18:40:37.826Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":272,"readers_count":271,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":506386,"topic_slug":"as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first","display_username":"6894 Lead prog/driver","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first/506386/2","custom_user_title":"6894 | Lead prog/Driver","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741440,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T18:43:10.265Z","cooked":"

The key is to just add one thing at a time. The most important thing is for your robot to drive. Are you using swerve? If so, it will be good to get that working first and take your time with it.

Then, make sure you understand the Command/Subsystem/Trigger environment and try writing commands that do something with the drivetrain.

Then work on getting basic autonomous commands working.

From there you could learn PathPlanner for better autos.

Once you have these mastered, you should look into understanding PID control of mechanisms.

You could then start digging into vision processing with the Limelight or PhotonVision.

That‚Äôs a lot for a first timer to master in a short off-season, but it should give you the basics you need to have a robot that can hold its own.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-17T18:43:10.265Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":256,"readers_count":255,"score":151.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506386,"topic_slug":"as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first/506386/3","custom_user_title":"5010 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3741445,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-09-17T18:44:06.928Z","cooked":"

Learn to use the simulator, dashboards/network tables, and AdvantageScope.

Get so comfortable with the simulator that you view testing on the actual robot as annoying, cumbersome, and something you only do when it comes time to prove it on the bot.

There will be a lot of times when you have a computer and don‚Äôt have a robot for whatever reason. Be able to be fully productive in those times and it will help your team immensely.

How comfortable are you with whatever language your team‚Äôs using? If not, start there. After you‚Äôve gotten basic proficiency in the language, it seems like you might have questions about the code structure and organization, so you might find this recent thread helpful. Hi i am new to programming and i need help

Also, several teams have published FRC specific programming training materials if you‚Äôd like to search CD for links to those. Here‚Äôs my team‚Äôs, for example (which i can also answer questions about if you have them)

BlueEpiphone:

The key is to just add one thing at a time.

seconding this. Focus on understanding one file/subsystem before moving on- something something ‚Äúeating an elephant one bite at a time‚Äù

BlueEpiphone:

The key is to just add one thing at a time.

+1. In addtional to this,

Learn how to use version control (Git) and how to keep everything properly documented. You will thanks your self when that ‚Äúone thing‚Äù you added don‚Äôt work.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-09-18T21:26:05.443Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":27.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":506386,"topic_slug":"as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/as-a-beginner-frc-programmer-what-concepts-or-things-should-i-learn-or-learn-to-do-first/506386/7","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3748243,"name":"Fatema M","username":"fnmerchant","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/d26b3c/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-09-26T00:33:06.993Z","cooked":"

What language does your team code in?

I know learning how to program can be daunting at first, but like everyone else said, I would just take it a step at a time.

For example, Team 3061, Huskie Robotics, releases an Open Source library each year that prevents us from rewriting the same robot code and is focused on a swerve-based drivetrain.

It‚Äôs called 3061 Lib, and our lead mentor releases videos explaining every part of 3061 lib, so I would highly reccomend watching those videos as it explains a lot of robot-specific code. We have commands in there, subsystems such as an Arm, Elevator, Manipulator, and Shooter. The videos that go through 3061 lib will be helpful, so if you do look at 3061 lib, make sure to watch the above videos!

We use 3061 Lib as our base code for each year, so understanding it might help you to build your own code for the build season.

Please reach out with any questions!

To be clear i was referring to this.

Introducing: Yet Another Software Suite! (YAMS, YALL, YAMG, YAGSL) Programming
Introducing YASS: Yet Another Software Suite Hey Chief Delphi! I know we have been hinting at this for a while and some of you may be frustrated but I promise it‚Äôs well worth the wait! We have been trying very hard to work out most of the bugs early on with these projects, and make them as accessible as possible. I hope you all enjoy them and it was worth the wait! Over the next few days everything will update from YAGSL branded to YASS branded and we will move YAGSL under our new git‚Ä¶
